title: How to Select Accessories for American Girl Dolls

steps.headline: Read a catalog or look at the American Girl website ahead of time to help decide what to buy.
Consider your budget.
steps.description: American Girl doll accessories are often priced more than other doll accessories which means that the cost of the accessories can add up quite quickly. In addition, doll furniture tends to be more expensive than clothes or smaller accessories.

steps.headline: Consider the ways that the owner of the doll enjoys playing with the doll.
steps.description: Some people are really into dressing up their doll, while others are more into putting it to sleep or taking care of it.

steps.headline: Consider the seasonality of the items.
steps.description: If a doll accessory is Christmas-themed, will it get played with during the rest of the year?

steps.headline: If the person you're buying for (whether it's yourself or someone else) is a young AG fan (roughly 7-9 - kids younger than that probably won't have AG dolls, because they're less likely to be able to take good care of them), consider how easy the accessory is to use.
steps.description: In the case of clothes, does it require a lot of snaps or is it something that would fall off the doll easily (like a hat).

steps.headline: Go to the AG Place and then go to the section that suits your doll.
steps.description: For example, if your doll is Kit, then you would go to the historical doll section and then to Kit. If you don't live near an American Girl Place, go to the website and click on the section for the doll you have.

steps.headline: Choose items that match the hobbies of the doll owner.
steps.description: American Girl has doll accessories for many common hobbies for girls.

steps.headline: Think of what colors you like.
steps.description: This is very important in terms of doll clothes. The colors of  American Girl clothes resemble that of retail clothing stores -- darker in the winter and brighter in the summer. If the person who owns the doll finds dark colors dreary, then winter clothing might not be the best thing to get.

text: Read a catalog or look at the American Girl website ahead of time to help decide what to buy.  Consider your budget. American Girl doll accessories are often priced more than other doll accessories which means that the cost of the accessories can add up quite quickly. In addition, doll furniture tends to be more expensive than clothes or smaller accessories. Consider the ways that the owner of the doll enjoys playing with the doll. Some people are really into dressing up their doll, while others are more into putting it to sleep or taking care of it. Consider the seasonality of the items. If a doll accessory is Christmas-themed, will it get played with during the rest of the year? If the person you're buying for (whether it's yourself or someone else) is a young AG fan (roughly 7-9 - kids younger than that probably won't have AG dolls, because they're less likely to be able to take good care of them), consider how easy the accessory is to use. In the case of clothes, does it require a lot of snaps or is it something that would fall off the doll easily (like a hat). Go to the AG Place and then go to the section that suits your doll. For example, if your doll is Kit, then you would go to the historical doll section and then to Kit. If you don't live near an American Girl Place, go to the website and click on the section for the doll you have. Choose items that match the hobbies of the doll owner. American Girl has doll accessories for many common hobbies for girls. Think of what colors you like. This is very important in terms of doll clothes. The colors of  American Girl clothes resemble that of retail clothing stores -- darker in the winter and brighter in the summer. If the person who owns the doll finds dark colors dreary, then winter clothing might not be the best thing to get.
